data.title: Ysgol John Bright reunion raises cash for hospice
data.meta_description: Old schools friends from Ysgol John Bright met over the summer to mark their 60th birthdays together. The gathering of ex-pupils was a greatRead more ⟶
data.text:
Old schools friends from Ysgol John Bright met over the summer to mark their 60th birthdays together.

Over 100 people attended the evening of entertainment at the North Wales Golf Club, some former students had travelled as far as Australia. The event was also attended by former teachers.

The gathering of ex-pupils was a great success and £300 was raised during the evening for St David’s Hospice.

Ex pupil and organiser Janette Tristram said:

“It was great to see everyone and support a very worthy local cause. “The event was over a year in the planning but it was worth it because we had such great fun.

“We know a lot of people over the years who have been cared for by St David’s Hospice and we hope that the money raised makes the patients’ lives easier.”

Hospice Community Fundraiser, James Wilde said:

“Thank you to everyone who attended the reunion. The event sounded like a great night and the money raised will help support the care offered here at St David’s Hospice.”
